required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Analysis of the Efficiency of Caplacizumab in the Treatment of aTTP
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Analysis of the Efficiency of Caplacizumab in the Treatment of Acquired Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (aTTP)- REACT-2020

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this national, prospective, multi-centre observational study is to describe the prescription rational and practice in Germany, confirm the efficacy of caplacizumab in a real-world setting, and identify predicting factors in iTTP-patients with regard to persistent autoimmune activity, therapy guidance and risk of complications. The rational is to develop new treatment algorithms that optimize overall patient outcome and reduce treatment cost.

primary_outcome.description: Description of the prescription rationale and practice of caplacizumab in the treatment of aTTP

secondary_outcome.description: Documentation of the efficacy of caplacizumab in the treatment of aTTP outside of clinical trials (real-world data)
Identification of risk factors for complications
Identification of risk factors for adverse outcomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk factors for persistent autoimmune activity
secondary_outcome.description: Identification of risk factors for persistent autoimmune activity
Identification of parameters that guide duration and regimen of caplacizumab treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of caplacizumab on adjunct treatments with PEX
secondary_outcome.description: Descriptions of duration and dose of therapeutic plasma exchange therapy (PEX), number of procedure-associated adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of caplacizumab on adjunct treatments
secondary_outcome.description: Descriptions of the effect of caplacizumab on dose, duration and number and severity of adverse events of glucocorticoids

arm_group.description: Patients with acquired Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura, who have been treated with caplacizumab (Cablivi®)

intervention.description: Intervention with Cablivi® take place outside of the study

study_pop.textblock: Male or female subjects with confirmed diagnosis of an acute episode of aquired thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura, who have been treated with one dose of caplacizumab.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of an acute episode of acquired thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura
- Treatment with at least one single dose of caplacizumab (10 mg i.v. or s.c.)
- Male or female patients ≥ 18 years of age
- signed written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hereditary thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura
- disability to give informed consent

overall_official.affiliation: Department II of Internal Medicine, University of Cologne
